messages.msgSnippet: Welcome to Laura and Stella. I m Amy unschooling mom to 3 girls. Samantha 7, Dana 4, and Casey 2. ... From: Laura M  To:
messages.messageBody:
Welcome to Laura and Stella. I'm Amy unschooling mom to 3 girls. Samantha 7,
Dana 4, and Casey 2.
----- Original Message -----
From: Laura M <lauramatec@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, July 03, 2000 2:49 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] (unknown)


> Hi Everyone,
> My name is Laura. I am new to Unschooling-dotcom. I have a
twelve-year-old
> stepson who would be in the seventh grade in the fall. We have recently
> decided to homeschool in September. He is very excited about this.
> Normally I wouldn't even mention that he is my stepson instead of my
> biological son, but I'm wondering how his mother is going to react to our
> family's decision to homeschool. We have joint residential custody and in
> the past she has been uninvolved in all aspects of our lives except
> visitation. Is anyone else in a similar situation or do you know of one?
I
> also have a four-year-old daughter who is also homeschooled. She is very
> excited that her brother will be home with her all of the time now.
> Thank You,
> Laura
>
>

Dachshunds! Eek, my dream dog! Some day I promise myself I will own a
dachshund, they are my absolute favorite breed. It will be pretty funny
looking because I'm 6' tall. How are they with children? ~Shelley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] (unknown)
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Everyone, My name is Laura.  I am new to Unschooling-dotcom.  I have a twelve-year-old stepson who would be in the seventh grade in the fall.  We have
messages.messageBody:
Hi Everyone,
My name is Laura. I am new to Unschooling-dotcom. I have a twelve-year-old
stepson who would be in the seventh grade in the fall. We have recently
decided to homeschool in September. He is very excited about this.
Normally I wouldn't even mention that he is my stepson instead of my
biological son, but I'm wondering how his mother is going to react to our
family's decision to homeschool. We have joint residential custody and in
the past she has been uninvolved in all aspects of our lives except
visitation. Is anyone else in a similar situation or do you know of one? I
also have a four-year-old daughter who is also homeschooled. She is very
excited that her brother will be home with her all of the time now.
Thank You,
Laura

>Tracy

> >people on this list personally, I feel like I know them all very well.
One
> >of the woman on the list with me has just suffered a terrible loss and
> >needs the love and support of many people. This woman recently (fri.
6/30)
> >gave birth to a beautiful baby boy. However due to shoulder dystoica the
> >baby's cord got pinned between his shoulder and the mother's pelvic
bone,
> >cutting off all supply to him. He was born not breathing and was taken to
> >the neonatal intensive care unit at a local hospital. A brain scan showed
> >now brain function at all. After deliberating with doctors during the day
> >on Friday it was decided that the baby should be removed from life
support.
> >This was to happen on Sat. Another person on the list alerted us to an
> >organization called Lily's bears that purchases bears for families
leaving
> >the hospital with empty cradles and broken hearts. Please give any
monetary
> >donation you feel is possible at this time. All remaining funds will be
> >used for sibling scholarships, etc. Even $1.00 can help. Thank you all,
in

> >Fort Langley
> >BC v1m2r7

messages.msgSnippet: Amy, You know, I didn t realize how much I counted on you guys as friends, but getting news like this...  I just broke down crying when I tried to tell my
messages.messageBody:
Amy,

You know, I didn't realize how much I counted on you guys as friends, but
getting news like this... I just broke down crying when I tried to tell my
husband. I will send something right away. By the way, I just
re-subscribed to the uua list so hopefully I will start getting emails from
them again.

Bonnie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] (unknown)
messages.msgSnippet: hi, relaxing is really the key.  your son s and your bond will do nothing but deep if you take care of both your needs and his needs and try to not allow your
messages.messageBody:
hi,

relaxing is really the key. your son's and your bond will do nothing but
deep if you take care of both your needs and his needs and try to not allow
your 'mother' and her deal to distract you from the truly loving
relationship you have with your son. the only needs that are important now
are yours and your sons. stay strong, enjoy your family (even if it's just
the 2 of you) and have as much fun as possible. one of our mottos is
'dessert first'. i've spent way too much of my life 'fixing' all the
things wrong with me now it's time to play:) i would recommend the same to
you:) just enjoy his wild antics as much as possible.

best wish
susan
austin,tx

> Thanks to all who offered advice and words of encouragment. It's nice
> to know that I'm not the only mother in the world who has a child who
> spins in circles when he's tired !! I'm just gonna try to relax and let
> my boy be a boy, even if that means letting him bounce off the walls !!
> Sus
